decision.summary: Local validation completed. Found 0 issues, 0 blockers.

nodes.name: Inaccurate information dissemination by ocean-domain conversational agent
nodes.description: Risk that BLAB-Chat returns outdated, wrong or fabricated statements about the Blue Amazon, potentially harming public understanding and decisions (Sections 1, 5).

nodes.name: Low engagement with ocean-related issues among Brazilian public
nodes.description: Risk that citizens remain unaware of biodiversity, food-security and climate stakes of the Blue Amazon, reducing support for protective measures (Introduction 1).

nodes.name: Scattered domain knowledge sources in Portuguese on Blue Amazon
nodes.description: Problem that relevant information is dispersed across reports, academic papers and databases, complicating retrieval and synthesis (Sect. 1).

nodes.name: Limited resources for NLP in low-resource languages
nodes.description: Problem that robust pretrained models, datasets and benchmarks exist mainly for English, hindering accuracy in Portuguese (Sect. 5 Lessons Learned).
aliases: lack of pretrained models in pt-BR

nodes.name: Domain-specific data curation improves NLP accuracy in specialized domains
nodes.description: Insight that collecting and curating Blue-Amazon-focused corpora can mitigate data sparsity and boost model performance (Sect. 3.1 QA, 4.1 Pirá).

nodes.name: Combining data-driven and knowledge-driven approaches increases reliability
nodes.description: Insight that integrating symbolic knowledge (graphs, rules) with neural models yields more faithful, explainable outputs (Sect. 2, 3.2).

nodes.name: Modular architecture with reasoner and harvester modules for data integration
nodes.description: Design principle that separates dialog-time reasoners from offline harvesters, coordinated by a controller accessing a data lake (Sect. 2).

nodes.name: Rule-based text generation for numerical fidelity
nodes.description: Design choice to employ template-based NLG so that tweets about tides, weather or vessels preserve exact numeric data (Sect. 3.1 Natural language generator).

nodes.name: Pirá 2.0 QA dataset creation
nodes.description: Implementation step producing 2 621 bilingual QA pairs, curated and extended for multiple benchmarks (Sect. 4.1).

nodes.name: Fine-tuning DEEPAGÉ QA model on Pirá 2.0
nodes.description: Mechanism adapting retriever-reader QA pipeline to the curated dataset, exploiting BM25 retrieval and PTT5 reader (Sect. 3.1 QA).

nodes.name: Knowledge graph generation from domain corpus
nodes.description: Mechanism that extracts OpenIE triples, merges synonyms with contextual embeddings and links graphs across documents (Sect. 3.2 Knowledge graph generator).

nodes.name: mRAT-SQL translator adaptation to Portuguese
nodes.description: Implementation of a language-agnostic RAT-SQL+GAP variant enabling Portuguese natural language queries over structured databases (Sect. 3.1 NL2SQL).

nodes.name: Template-based NLG pipeline in BLAB-Reporter
nodes.description: Six-stage pipeline (content selection→realisation) that converts Blue-Amazon numerical feeds into natural-language tweets (Sect. 3.1 NLG).

nodes.name: Dual BM25+PTT5 QA performance improvement on domain questions
nodes.description: Evaluation showing dual system outperforms retriever-only or reader-only baselines on Blue-Amazon questions (Sect. 3.1 QA).

nodes.name: Rule-based NLG ensures high-fidelity numerical reports
nodes.description: Authors state rule approach guarantees exact numerical content although with lower textual diversity (Sect. 3.1 NLG).

nodes.name: PTT5-Paraphrase evaluation shows high semantic fidelity
nodes.description: Manual study finds no statistical loss in meaning vs human paraphrases, while increasing diversity (Sect. 3.2 Paraphraser).

nodes.name: Curate and expand Blue Amazon domain datasets for model training
nodes.description: Ongoing collection of reports, news, and expert-written wiki texts to augment Pirá and related resources, feeding all future model pre-training.

nodes.name: Fine-tune QA systems on Pirá 2.0 and domain corpus
nodes.description: Continual fine-tuning of the DEEPAGÉ retriever-reader pipeline using curated QA pairs and documents to improve answer correctness.

nodes.name: Deploy rule-based NLG pipeline for BLAB-Reporter tweets
nodes.description: Operate the six-stage template NLG to post accurate tide, weather and vessel updates on Twitter, broadening public outreach.

nodes.name: Integrate knowledge graphs into QA retrieval pipeline
nodes.description: Use automatically generated Blue-Amazon knowledge graphs to expand query candidates and re-rank passages before reader stage.

nodes.name: Implement multilingual NL2SQL translator mRAT-SQL in conversation backend
nodes.description: Expose mRAT-SQL through controller so BLAB-Chat can translate Portuguese user questions into SQL queries over maritime databases.
